title: Bride-to-be Lisa Faulkner enjoys her cocktail-soaked hen do
text:
She is preparing to tie the knot with chef John Torode.

And Lisa Faulkner ensured she bid farewell to single life in style over the weekend as she joined her gal pals - including Amanda Holden, Tamzin Outhwaite and Angela Griffin - in living it up at swanky Soho Farmhouse.

The Holby City actress, 47, was feeling cheeky as she larked around during the trip as she slipped into underwear to lark around in a bath before indulging in some cocktails and food at the upmarket venue.

Larking around: Lisa Faulkner ensured she bid farewell to single life in style over the weekend as she joined her gal pals - including Amanda Holden, Tamzin Outhwaite and Angela Griffin - in living it up at swanky Soho Farmhouse

Lisa, who has been dating John since 2015, announced the proposal in an Instagram post earlier this year and is now headed towards the big day.

Ahead of the festivities she was living it up with her gals at Soho Farm House, where they were sipping on the signature cocktails Picante de la Casa.

While she herself shared a shot from inside a bath while donning black lingerie, she later changed into a stunning pink dress with a statement bride hat.

Joining her was Amanda, who nabbed the dazzling hat for a picture, with an added caption reading: '@lisafaulknercooks hat which I pinched for this photo! #hennight #subtle #boughtandpaidfor'.

Pretty: Joining her was Amanda, who nabbed the dazzling hat for a picture, with an added caption reading: '@lisafaulknercooks hat which I pinched for this photo! #hennight #subtle #boughtandpaidfor'

A vision: Ever the supportive pal, she wore a dress from Amanda's collection

The ladies later changed into personalised pyjamas adorned with the words: 'Lisa's Hen' and paired with tartan bottoms.

She added a caption reading: 'Thank you my lovely friends for giving me the best hen ever!!! I love you all and my heart is bursting with happiness'.

Angela also shared a shot with the note: “Hens in Pen Yen” Very, very funny night celebrating this ones impending nuptials. Enough Picante De La Casa’s to sink a ship, All the Way Jay entertained and we danced our socks off. Happy Hen'.

Happy days: The ladies later changed into personalised pyjamas adorned with the words: 'Lisa's Hen' and paired with tartan bottoms

Oh yes it's ladies' night! Angela also shared a shot with the note: “Hens in Pen Yen” Very, very funny night celebrating this ones impending nuptials. Enough Picante De La Casa’s to sink a ship, All the Way Jay entertained and we danced our socks off. Happy Hen'

Prior to her hen do, Lisa appeared on Loose Women, where she told the panel about John's romantic moment, as she said: 'It was a very romantic proposal.

'He asked me on Christmas Day when we were in India and he said we can only have one present each and I gave him pair of yoga pants and he gave me a ring. I had no idea, the box was bigger than the ring and I had no idea.’

John added: ‘Months before she tried a ring on and I said ‘’yeah whatever’’ and she didn’t know I went back and got it.’

Having a laugh: Ahead of the festivities she was living it up with her gals at Soho Farm House, where they were sipping on the signature cocktails Picante de la Casa

All star friends: They were joined by Angela Griffin, Amanda and Tamzin Outhwaite

The pair, who have been dating since 2015, announced the proposal in an Instagram post earlier this year.

Taking to Instagram Lisa wrote: 'My gorgeous John completely surprised me on Christmas Day and asked me to marry him!

'After waiting to tell our family when we got home we then had a few days just grinning at each other!! I'm so very happy to share our lovely news with you.

'Happy 2019 it’s going to be quite a year and I’m going to embrace every minute of it. All you need is love. Love is all you need.'

WOW! It certainly seemed to be a raucous affair given the girls' behaviour and cheeky posts

Here come the girls! The ladies were sipping on cocktails as they prepared to live it up

During the show, the couple, who recently teamed up for the cooking show John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen, also discussed what it was like to live and work together.

John said: ‘We learn to cook very differently and what I get from Lisa is this great joy of relaxing. She is an incredible cook because her mum taught her to cook.

Lisa added: ‘It’s amazing what I have learnt from him and when you are with someone that knows their stuff its fascinating.'

Earlier this year, Lisa candidly opened up about her experience with IVF during an appearance on ITV's This Morning.
